data.title: Thumbs Up on the Thumb Cookies!!
data.text:
Hear about Almond Sisters on Facebook but also knew one of my high school classmates from 1997 owned it.  I happened to be in the area and stopped by there with our children.   Ordered some cookies and they were the best thumb cookies I ever had!  To be honest, I really didn't want to share with my kids.  I usually order Busken cookies for my out of state clients but now I'm going to start ordering the thumb print cookies instead.  
SO AMAZING!!

data.title: Saturday morning bruch
data.text: We were walking at the local Saturday morning farmers market across the street when we decided to stop in for a pastry. Instead of going sweet we went for a hot out of the oven pastry stuffed with cheddar cheese, ham, turkey, tomato, and bacon. The open ended pastry crust was light and flaky, the cheese melted to an gooey, just the right amount thinly sliced meat to make a great meal. We liked it so much that we went back for the thumb print cookies. Light and airy butter cookies with a proportional dab of frosting. Reasonable prices for a superior product!

data.title: Best cookies ever!
data.text: They have these amazing thumbprint cookies, that are amazing! Amazing! Amazing! All there bakegoods are incredible.

data.title: Cinnamon roll and coffee awesomeness
data.text: Great spot to watch people and get my morning coffee.  Even had a kid playing music as I ordered.  Nice non chain new business in downtown Hamilton. Feels like a northwest coffee shop inside.

data.title: Wow. Delicious!
data.text: We stopped by farmers market and decided to try this new bakery. My husband had a cinnamon roll and I had a turkey croissant. Both were excellent. We got our coffees and sat outside. Inside there was a guitar player and outside we heard the music from the market. Great find.

data.title: Delicious and super kind folks
data.text: We had a really nice stop here while visiting Hamilton for business. We bought a couple of "geodes" - chocolate chip cookies wrapped around a brownie. Yum! Several local shop owners referred us back to the Almond Sisters, and we are so glad we went. The owners and bakers really are sisters and their partners, and they were all very kind to us. Delicious breads and pastries!!!!

data.title: Hits my sweet spot
data.text:
I have been to the Sisters on several occasions and have not been disappointed.  My go-to sweet is their button cookies.  The almond twists, unicorn horns, geode and death-by-chocolate are still vying for 2nd place.  Hmm, more testing needs to be done.  They also make excellent lunch, for lack of a better term, croissants.  The staff is cheerful and efficient and the store is very clean, which is to be expected, since the building has been rehabbed, vastly improving downtown Hamilton's character with a variety of small businesses.

My only problem, and this is not the Bakery's fault, is the lack of parking, but, IMHO, the search for a space is worth the effort.

data.title: Great selection of freshly baked items
data.text: Staff was friendly and helpful.  Food was great and was fresh.  Prices were mostly reasonable..   They take special orders and have a wide variety of options.

data.title: Breads, Rolls & Pastries - Eat Well ; Get them here!
data.text:
1) super nice folks - friendly, attentive and they know how to bake 
2) Almond Straws - their signature dish - get two (at least) 
3) Savory Danish - Cheddar and Bacon --- if you've ever had to suffer through an fast food breakfast sandwich - order this >> the grand Kharmic wheel spins in your favor... these are so good 
4) had the apple turnover - an apple starfish shaped piece of -ohh, that's so good-- 
5) they had samples of something made with two layers of M&M cookie dough and maybe funfetti cake... I had one and wished they weren't looking so that I could have snatched two more
